My PC only has a 400 watt power supply and this one plugs directly into the motherboard and doesn't require any other power cables to be connected. And I was able to take full advantage of the Radeon technology in my monitor - was able to set it to 185mhz refresh rate too. Fortnite looks 1000 times better!

data.label: MAXSUN AMD Radeon RX 550 4GB Low Profile Small Form Factor Video Graphics Card for Gaming Computer PC GPU GDDR5 ITX SFF HDPC 128-Bit DirectX 12 PCI Express X16 3.0, HDMI, DisplayPort

Reviews.title: It does what I needed it to do
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
Reviews.text:
At my workplace I needed this half-height graphics card for a PC running a graphics intensive application that was practically unusable using the on-board graphics on the PC. Installing this card resolved the performance issues. I was pleased enough with that purchase that I bought one for my home computer to resolve some lag issues when playing 4K video on my old PC. This card resolved that issue, too. I don't know how this product benchmarks against the completion. I didn't do any testing like that. I simply had performance issues with applications that needed a graphics card performance boost. The price was right on this graphics card and I found that it worked fine to resolve those issues.

The only issue that I had was that the package came with no English instructions, no drivers and no software. I am an IT technician by trade, so I had little trouble finding the right drivers and software online. On one PC, Windows Update found the drivers, but I still had to download and install the correct version of the Radeon software. On the other PC I had to download both the drivers and software. So, this wasn't much of a problem for me, but it may be more than a novice PC users can deal with.

This product did what I needed and I've had no problems with it either at home or at work. It gets a 5 star rating from me even though I would have expected better instructions for installing the product and obtaining the correct drivers & software.

Reviews.title: Works Great. No Extra Power Needed.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
Reviews.text: I needed a low profile video card for a small form factor computer that didn't require it's own power source, and didn't cost a fortune. This one fit all 3 requirements. It was a simple install and the software was easy to find and download.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on August 29, 2022
Reviews.text:
Diese Grafikkarte ist absolout NICHT VR fähig ! Wer VR möchte MUSS mehr investieren !

Dennoch möchte ich diese Grafikkarte einmal für ihre erstaunliche und herausragende Leistung loben.
Hier hat MAXSUN alles richtig gemacht!

Ich habe einen Rechner mit ordentlich Leistung und natürlich auch mit einer entsprechenden Grafikkarte um damit die Valve Index VR-Brille zu betreiben. Ich bekam ein ausrangiertes Fujitsu Esprimo C710 mit USB3.0 und einem betagten aber ausreichenden Prozessor und suchte nun nach einer Low Profile Grafikkarte, die dabei auch noch schlank und bestmögliche Leistung bringen sollte.

Mein verrückter Plan:
Wenn an meinem Rechner was abraucht, sollte der kleine Esprimo das Ganze überbrücken.
Mit 32GB RAM und der MAXSUN Radeon RX 550 ist mir das sehr gut gelungen.
Wir reden hier natürlich von minimalistischen Grafikeinstellungen ABER BeatSaber, Phasmophobia (SinglePlayer), Pistol Whip und Blade & Sorcery sind durchaus spielbar und die Karte wird dabei nicht übermäßig heiß. Half Life - Alyx hingegen lagt sehr deutlich (wie es auch zu erwarten ist)

Dies ist keine Kaufempfehlung für VR, es soll aber verdeutlichen, was die kleine Karte auf dem Kasten hat.
Denn hier schlägt sie die vergleichbare GT 1030 um längen. Für Titel wie Diablo III und Co ifinde ich die RX 550 völlig in Ordnung und sie macht dort auch eine echt gute Figur.

Fazit: Es gibt natürlich deutlich stärkere Grafikkarten, egal ob AMD oder NVIDIA aber wer bei dem aktuellen Auf und Ab der Grafikkartenpreise eine günstige und verhältnismäßig starke Grafikkarte sucht, weil er sich gerade keine große leisten kann oder wie bei mir für einen kleineren Zweitrechner, sollte hier gut bedient sein.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on September 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
Hab wirklich lange und intensiv nach einer neuen, bezahlbaren und vom Preis nicht so abgehobenen Grafikkarte gesucht. Hier passt das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis für mich gerade noch so. Wir zocken wenig wenn dann Strategiespiele, Autorennen usw eine unserer Anforderungen war die Grafik entscheidend zu verbessern ohne Unmengen Geld zu investieren. Also neuer Monitor, Grafikkarte und ein zusätzlicher Speicherblock. Das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen!!!
Kein geruckel mehr und eine schön saubere Grafik, das beste die Grafikkarte wird bei uns nicht mal warm, läuft also alles sauber. Für 160€ kann man bei der Karte nichts verkehrt machen!

Reviews.title: HD5770s and 6770s never came with 4GB of VRAM! AVOID!!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
Reviews.text:
The vast majority of HD6770s did not come with a VGA port. The real ones also require a 6-pin power connector. Most cards that have an output layout like this are fake and, seeing reviews from people saying it won't run DX11, I'm inclined to believe this isn't even a 6770 as those did run DX11. The listed clock speed is about 200mhz lower than the original cards which, at best, points to these being faulty cards flashed with a different BIOS to operate at a lower clock speed. HD 5770s and 6770s (same card with 2 names) also NEVER came with 4GB of VRAM.

Again, this points to this being a card with a fake BIOS. I've tested another faked GPU claiming to be a GTX 960 4GB and the card even reported itself as such to the computer. In actuality it was a GT640 with 1GB of VRAM. When a game would try to utilize the reported 4GB of VRAM that didn't exist, it would cause the computer to crash.

Best case scenario here, you get a GPU that was originally released in 2009 (as the 5770, again, identical to the 6770...AMD just renamed the same card 2 years later) which has not received driver support since 2015, running at 76% of it's original speed (which may be how it gets away without a 6 pin power connector...but I doubt it) and have to spend some time dialing in settings to avoid games using more than 1GB of VRAM so the computer won't crash. In other words KEEP SHOPPING!

Reviews.title: Good Enough
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
Reviews.text:
My employer bought a stack of Dell 5080's (very basic) and I bought one from her. I loaded up the memory and changed to an SSD. It doesn't take much to elevate this. I also wanted to get a discrete video card and take the load off the onboard video. Saw this card. 4GB? At this price? In my case, it's overkill, but more is better, right? I counted on Amazon's liberal return policy and took the gamble. I changed to the low-profile bracket, ditching the VGA port and downloaded the latest NVIDIA drivers. I'm pleased to say this card and its 4GB are running two 27" monitors essentially straight from setup. I don't know why other reviews can't run more than one monitor, but I also don't know their level of expertise. I come from that 90's & 2000's group that went and got bits and pieces at Fry's and popped them into the computer case, learning by trial and error. I'm no expert, but I can get by.

There is absolutely nothing in the box other than the card and the low-profile bracket. You'll have to go to NVIDIA dot com to get your drivers. I disk or leaflet with minimal instructions wouldn't go amiss with some of the purchasers.

Anyway...good video card, reliable (so far) after four weeks, and I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.title: Doesn't work
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022
Reviews.text:
I don't want to do any gaming, I wanted a cheap card that could drive a drive one VGA monitor with 1920x1200 and one HDMI monitor with 1440x2560.
There were no directions in the box, and almost nothing written on the box. The Amazon website had a lot more information than the box.
The Amazon website says that KAER offers 24-hour technical support, but doesn't say what the URL for that is and neither does the box. www.kaer.com is an air-conditioning company, and Google just turns up a ton of false hits.
When I installed the card and turned the CPU on, it only detected one monitor and was confused about it. Windows -> System -> Display says it was 1024x769 with no other options, but stuff that was supposed to be in the center of the screen was at the edge of the screen. Websites kept coming up where the buttons were off the bottom of the screen when the top of the window was at the top of the screen.
The colors were all wrong, too.
I figured it was a driver problem, so with great difficulty I went to the NVIDEA website and downloaded the driver for the NVIDEA Geforce GT 730 (the box says nothing about NVIDEA and there are no directions, I was just going by what the Amazon website said).
Installing the driver made no difference. I did it twice.
I give up. I'm sending this back to Amazon, never buying anything from KAER again.

data.label: MAXSUN GEFORCE GT 1030 2GB GDDR5 Video Graphics Card GPU Mini ITX Design, HDMI, DVI-D, Single Fan Cooling System

Reviews.title: It Works...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
OK, it arrived on time, but that is sort of an issue. When I purchased this product, Amazon guaranteed delivery on Sunday Feb. 6, 2022. On the 6th, I woke up to an email that it would be delayed until Monday the 7th. No problem, we had a blizzard and people have been digging out. BUT, it was delivered on Sunday and just left outside, in the freezing cold and snow, without me knowing or expecting it was going to happen. Luckily, a friend stopped in for five minutes, and by coincidence that's when the package was left in the cold and snow, so it wasn't there when he came up the porch, but it was there when he went down and my package got to me safely. The seller bears no responsibility for this, as it was fulfilled by Amazon, but for some reason, Amazon doesn't let us write reviews for the customer service, so here it is. You can do better, Amazon.

As for the product itself, it's not really as bad as my "stars" would suggest. It arrived in what appears to be brand new packaging. I can't find any evidence that the anti-static bag was ever opened before. I installed it in my aging Dell Inspiron 3700 (with an i5-8400, and 12GB of RAM) hooked it all up, turned it on, and after about 5 minutes of some installation process (at which time there WAS video) my screen automatically reverted to the display settings it had prior to the install, and it works just fine. I installed Nvidia GeForce and, after one more driver update it was over. The entire process was from start to finish was less than 20 minutes.

This was the first time I have ever installed a GPU, and I can only assume that that is EXACTLY how it is supposed to work. As for the value for money, NO GPU has a good value to money ratio. Crypto-miners and the pandemic have seen to that.

As for gaming, this just is NOT a card built to plays today's most advanced games. I got this card because PGA 2K21 can only track one profile at a time, so two people with two profiles need two copies of the game to track their stats in co-op. Now, my aging Dell could manage about 25 FPS in "potato mode," a number that made it unplayable. With this card, on low settings (one step up from potato mode), this card and the i5 deliver 90FPS steadily at 1080p quality.

The problem there, is that 2K21 is really "The Golf Club 3" with 2K's marketing slapped on the box. As such, the entire install from Steam was just 6.6GB. And as every modern gamer knows, the 5-15GB game file size was lost to any game above the 'indie" classification when the games went 4K. Which means that the game would have to still be in potato mode if 4K textures even existed in the files for processing.

The only other "modern" game I have on the Dell is Kerbal Space Program. And that, with low settings turned on, and the FPS locked to 80, this card and the i5 can get maintain a steady 60 in the assembly buildings and launchpad, and dropped into the 40 FPS range during the launches I tested. But that is normal. KSP can make even monster PC's cry for mercy if the user launches a big enough ship. The limitation there is far more CPU dependent than GPU dependent as the game tries to simulate physics, heat, and gravity calculations on hundreds of individual parts simultaneously.

As for video streaming, honestly, I don't see very much improvement over the streaming quality of just the i5, but there is no LESS quality to the streaming, and that's what matters. My monitor is a 32" 1440p, with a 144 Hz refresh rate.

I do, however, have a couple of issues with this card. On the product description page, there is clearly a picture of the various output I expected to find on this card. And if I remember right that picture had a display port, an HDMI port, a 24 pin DVI port, and a VGA port (I might be wrong about the VGA port). The card that arrived at my house, does NOT have either a VGA port or a display port. So, if your monitor has either of those, BUYER BEWARE!!! I was only ever going to use the HDMI port, so I'm not too fussed.

My bigger issue is the plastic shroud on the GPU itself. The card doesn't cover the same amount of area that the plastic shroud does, so I have several square inches of exposed plastic shroud inside my PC, acting as a "bowl" to catch any dust flying around. And while the Dell has a paper filter the covers the main air intake, and a sort of cone directing the CPU exhaust directly out into the room and that has kept the amount of dust inside my case to a minimum. But now there is the GPU fan sourcing air from an unfiltered area, and just exhausting the air inside the case. So, ALL bets are off as to how this plays out in the remaining life left in my aging Dell.

That is just BAD design all the way around. It uses more material than is strictly needed meaning the manufacturer is paying more than is strictly necessary for each card manufactured, and it CAN'T be good for the PC to have an actual dust catcher inside a machine that you work hard to keep dust free. And I can PROMISE the manufacturer, that if my aging Dell suddenly dies six weeks from now, I know EXACTLY who I will blame. I won't get a refund, but THEY won't get a return customer.

And for that reason, ultimately, I will give this GPU a 3-star rating with a serious "BUYER BEWARE" due to the misleading product photos, as well as the poorly designed fan shroud.

data.label: Diamond BizView BV200 PCI 128MB Multi View Graphics Card
data.description: e Diamond's BV200 is designed for multi-taskers to enhance business productivity, from your home use all the way up to corporate enterprise use. The BizView Multi-View Graphics card can organize, control, deliver, monitor, and communicate your work more effectively by allowing Dual Digital Display support. These cards will focus on the business users with an emphasis on productivity, extended life, and low heat. Specifications include PCI Express x16 bus type, 256MB of GDDR2 memory, 450mhz core clock, dual 400 mhz RAMDACS, DMS-59 display connector for dual digital display support. This product is low profile at 2.3" x6.6" and supports HDTV through dual DVI-I outputs or dual monitors both through VGA or one DVI and one VGA. System requirements include Intel Pentium 4 or AMD Athlon 64 FX, System memory of 512mb or higher, a VGA or DVI-I compatible monitor, 420 Watt or greater power supply, 90mb of available hard drive space, PCI Express X16 compliant slot, a cd-rom or dvd-rom drive, and Windows 2000 or newer OS. Package contents include Diamond Video Card Installation CD, Quick Start Guide, Limited Lifetime Warranty Card, DVI to VGA converter, S-Video Cable, and DMS59 Adapter.

Reviews.title: Great Dual monitor video card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2009
Reviews.text: This video adapter delivers great performance and great resolution. Also, it has many features that can be managed with the provided software.

Reviews.title: Does not perform as claimed
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2007
Reviews.text: I bought this video card intending to use it with two standard 19" LCD displays. After installing it exactly as instructed, I had terrible picture quality. After two calls to tech support (25 min hold each time) I learned that actually the BizView BV200 cannot support two monitors in digital mode in their native resolutions. My choice was to bump the resolution way down or switch to analog (not as sharp). The packaging says front and center "Dual Digital LCD Support" It just isn't really true.
